citation.article-title: Microlunatus phosphovorus gen. nov., sp. nov., a new gram-positive polyphosphate-accumulating bacterium isolated from activated sludge.

p.s: Microlunatus (Mi. cro.lu.na'tus. Gr. adj. micros, small; M. L. n. lunatus, half moon; M. L. n. Microlunatus, small moon-like microorganism)
Cells are spherical (diameter, 0.8 to 2.0 Î¼m) and occur singly, in pairs, or in some cases in clusters.
The cells often have a cell wall structure in the middle of the cell and are hemispherical, especially at the stationary growth phase.
Aerobic and chemoorganotrophic, having a strictly respiratory type of metabolism with oxygen as the terminal electron acceptor.
The cells reduce nitrate to nitrite but do not reduce nitrite to nitrogen.
The cell wall peptidoglycan contains LL-DAP.
The major fatty acids are anteiso-C15:0, iso-C15:0, and iso-C16:0.
The G+C content of the DNA is 67.9 mol%.
The phylogenetic position is in the high-G+ C-content group of gram-positive bacteria; the genera Aeromicrobium and Nocardioides are the closest relatives.
The type species is Microlunatus phosphovorus.
